title: ID 90s grunge font
content:
I need help identifying a grunge font from the 90s used for a CD that I am trying to get reprinted.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130625031026im_/http:/typophile.com/files/identify_font_5916.jpg)
author: dconstruct

comments.content:
Similar to Doodlebug, Deadman, and Chiller, but none of those match exactly.

- Lex
Thanks—those are all close and much better matches than what-the-font could come up with—but still no cigar. Any other ideas?

That's Stroke by Frank Ford.  
It used to be available through Thirstype I think, in the weights Thin, Thick and Off.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130625031026im_/http:/typophile.com/files/stroke_4192.jpg)

magnus
